name: The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: JUST AWESOME
reviews.text: If you are tired of the run of the mill hotel, this one is FIRST class...do NOT hesitate to stay here. The bathroom alone is worth the trip! Upgrade to the Club level, it is worth it....

This place is simply amazing! There is a lot of history in the Battle House which in itself makes it a neat place to stay. The room was very spacious and the bathroom nearly as big as the room with a separate shower and tub. The staff were very professional and the food in the restaurant was very good. But the best and one of the most important factors, the bed was extremely comfortable. I can easily say I've never slept on a bed better than here!
reviews.title: Amazing Place to Stay

reviews.text: Had two free nights from Marriott from an earlier promotion they ran. These were good at hotels up to level 4 (Mariott categorizes their hotels 1 through 7). Was very surprised that this beautiful place was only classified as a 4. Anyway, we all loved the place. Beautiful lobby, rooftop pool and tennis court, and the area around the hotel was reminiscent of the New Orleans French Quarter. Exercise room very well furnished, and also empty, as all hotel exercise rooms are... Will return if we're in the area.
reviews.title: You'll Like It

reviews.text: I enjoy old hotels when they are well maintained, and the Battle House is well maintained. While room layouts reflect the slight awkwardness of some modernizations, the rooms in which I have stayed were nicely decorated and comfortable. Public spaces are especially beautiful. This is the top of the line hotel in Mobile, but by the standards of most cities this level of luxury comes at a good value.
reviews.title: Classic Hotel

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. Our room (2 queens) was enormous, as was the bathroom. The staff were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to Montgomery and it was a beautiful hotel. The lobby is absolutely breathtaking. The hotel was a lot larger than we were expecting, which didn't really bother us at all. We stayed in the tower part of the hotel and our room was really nice. It was a little confusing finding our way to the pool, but it was decently sized for a roof-top pool and we enjoyed our time there. There are tennis-courts on the roof that guests could use too, which was a neat find. The staff was very friendly (especially the ladies at the front desk). We did not eat in the restaurant, but we did order room service. It was delivered in 25 minutes, as promised, and was decent - the fruit cup had a definite pickle-taste which was a little unexpected, but that was probably the worst part of our stay, which is a pretty great thing. We really enjoyed our stay at the Battle House and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in Mobile

reviews.text: The Battle House was an old hotel that was closed for many years in downtown Mobile, Alabama. It was fairly recently restored with the integrity of an old gracious Southern hotel. I was there for a wedding. The service could not have been better. Room service was prompt and fairly priced. The location was great near the Convention Center and Dalphne Street - the main drag - in downtown Mobile. The room prices were fair for the large room and bathroom that I had. I would defintly stay here again in Mobile!
reviews.title: Hotel was beautiful and historic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel, the likes of which you rarely see now. It has a grand foyer and ballrooms. The staff is outstanding and genuinely friendly. The rooms are spacious and very comfortably furnished. Internet, safe, and morning coffee in the lobby were free (any other 4* hotels listening?). The marble bathroom was hugh and had a tub and large walkin shower. They forgot to put a towel hook or bar within reach of the shower though. The bar had live entertainment on Friday night and was lively without being too loud.
reviews.title: Beautifully restored hotel downtown

reviews.text: Overall an excellent place to stay in downtown Mobile. Unfortunately, there didn't seem to be much else in downtown Mobile.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Battle House
Wonderful Hotel!!
reviews.text: Warning: apparently they sell local memberships to their pool and gym. We got there around 10:00am on Saturday and got the last 2 lounges chairs. From 11:00am to 4:00pm people were either standing or sitting in the pool. While I understand the business sense of this, it is unfair to hotel guests who cannot find a place to sit at the pool. Another pool hint- get a chair at the edge of the pergola on the right side. The sun gets very hot in the afternoon and you can get in the shade if you want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire hotel is restored to its former beauty. We toured each floor. and were so impressed with the cleanliness and the friendliness of all of the employees. We will be staying there again next year for our anniversary!
reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful!

reviews.text: This hotel is in the centre of Mobile and is easy to find - just head for the tallest building. Staff were polite but not artificially friendly. The main reception hall is big and tidy. It features a number of architectual styles. Breakfast featured as much food as you could wish for but the price varied daily for the same meal. My room had no openable windows so no chance of fresh air. Room service was good but in the five days I stayed, one day got skipped. The Tavern Bar next to the hotel is a good place to relax at night and on a couple of times it had a piano player. Hotel staff were helpful in arranging taxis, putting back check-out to match flights and picking up printouts. The hotel is not expensive and certainly worth a visit if you are in Mobile. Pity about the windows.
reviews.title: Good base for business

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in Mobile at the Battle House. When you walk in it looks wonderful and you think it's going to be a great stay, but things were not all good for us.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had reserved two rooms with king size beds, when we got there they told us there were none available. We settled for two rooms with 2 double beds. It didn't take us long to realize that the thermostat in our room didn't work. We were freezing and all we could do was turn it off and then back on later. The toilet rocked back and forth when you sat on it, not just the seat, the whole toilet. You could tell that it had been like that for awhile since the grout around the bottom on the floor was all coming lose. It felt like it was going to tip over. We reported it so I hope it was fixed before they put someone else in there. We called the next morning and asked to be moved and they tried to get us to just stay there while they sent maintenance. I asked if there were any king bed rooms available and when they said yes I told them we wanted to change rooms. They sent a bellman up to help, which was nice. Our relatives moved also since there was another king size room available. The worst part of the stay was that the entire hotel was freezing all the time. It was 100 degrees outside but it was better than being in the lobby. I don't know how the people who work there can stand it. Service for breakfast was awful. They only had one women on duty who even tried to take care of anyone. The hostess out front kept wandering off, and the people who were supposed to be getting coffee and water would just walk through the room and out the other side. The only server in the room was trying to take care of about 40 people, and seating others when the hostess was no where to be found. I felt bad for her.
reviews.title: So good we booked another trip!

reviews.text: In short we were disappointed with our stay. It's beautiful, but not what we expected.
reviews.title: We will be back !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely and the check-in service was great from the bell-hop to the registration clerk. Both were very helpful! There is a cool bar on the ground floor where we stopped in and had a quick bite and a drink. The food was really good -- not something you expect at a bar! The rooms are very nice, as is typical with a Renaissance, but I can't say enough about how beautiful the spa is. Many times the auctual facility does not measure up to the photos on line. Not the case in this instance -- it is lovely! The service at the spa is good but not great. The reason I say that is that when we arrived, they did not have our reservation listed in their computer. The receptionist immediately panicked, made a big fuss and went to get the manager. The manager quickly took charge and handled the situation very professionally, even giving us a 10% discount for the mix-up. Also, some of the staff were "loud" -- not something you expect in a spa. Overall, it was a great experience!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and the Spa is Amazing!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night for a baseball game. I picked this one because of all the great reviews.I'm glad I did too because it was super nice! The lobby is beautiful! The valet is awesome too. They were very nice and quick to get our car when we needed it. The front desk were very nice and welcoming. We stayed in the standard king room on the 6th floor and it was very quiet, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was huge and elegant! With a glass shower and garden tub. Room service was great,not a lot of food selections but the food was very good. Overall the stay was excellent!
reviews.title: Frequent travelers from florida

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, staff is very friendly, food is good. Will definitely visit this hotel again. Hotel has a certain historic feel and ambiance that makes for a truely unique experience.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.text: My mom and I took a 3 day girls trip to Mobile and stayed in the Battle House. The lobby is spectacular and the check-in service was great. I was a little hesitant to stay here because the only pictures I had seen were of the lobby, but the room did not disappoint. In fact, it was probably the largest hotel room I've ever stayed in at this price point. We had a two queen bed room on the third floor which had ample space on all sides of the bed as well as a seating area with a queen anne style chair and ottoman and a desk. The bathroom was HUGE and beautiful with a soaker tub and separate shower. We had the breakfast buffet one morning in the Trellis Room which was delicious. We also went to the Joe Cain Cafe and got delicious adult beverages that we brought up to the beautiful roof top terrace. Very nice space up there. On our final night, we stopped in at the Royal Street Tavern for drinks. We loved the atmosphere and service so much we ended up staying for dinner. There was a fabulous pianist and saxophone player and the food was superb. You have to try the creme cheese dip! We also visited the spa once for an hour long massage. My mom was very happy with hers, mine was okay, but a little rough. However, the Quiet Room totally made up for the massage itself. It's a dim lit room with a floor to ceiling fire pit...you have to see this thing! There's also a large hot tub in there, but we didn't get in. Overall, everything from check-in to valet to extra services was outstanding and we will be staying there again.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: Stayed one night with family on the way to Orange Beach. Hotel is spectacular, the rooftop pool and fitness area are very nice. We did have an issue with the room not being clean but the staff was able to help get us moved and took care of breakfast and parking for us. The breakfast buffet was superb.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

aka: The Battle House, a Renaissance Hotel
description: Discover The Battle House Renaissance Hotel & Spa, one of the premiere hotels in Mobile, Alabama, located downtown in the Central Business District across from the Mobile Convention Center. This downtown hotel in Mobile, AL has been a favorite of entertainment celebrities, sports legends, a president and a king since 1852. The Battle House was thoughtfully resorted to its original grandeur and is a proud member of Historic Hotels of America. This legendary AAA Four Diamond Hotel also offers The Trellis Room, Mobile's only Four Diamond Restaurant. The Spa at The Battle House is a 10,000 sq. ft. oasis boasting a full salon, eight treatment rooms, and a Zen-like fire pit in our spectacular, tranquil Quiet Room. Host unforgettable affairs inside the magnificent Crystal Ballroom & marvel at our whispering arches (our acoustical feature). Join us in Mobile's Living Room, located just steps from Mobile's Entertainment District, Gulf Coast Exploreum & Imax, the Carnival Museum, Museum of Mobile & Fort Conde.
